de.a46.memory.gui
Class LeftPanel

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.awt.Component
        |
        +--java.awt.Container
              |
              +--java.awt.Panel
                    |
                    +--de.a46.memory.gui.LeftPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
public class LeftPanel
extends java.awt.Panel

Class LeftPanel is the left part of the memory screen. Size is 240 x 480 pixels. It is child to MainPanel and father of two MultiImagePanels, that can display card Images. To receive events, when the user clicks an Image, you can register a MPanelListener.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Till Zoppke
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

LeftPanel

Constructor. Subcomponents will be constructed as well.
Parameters:

Method Detail

init

public void init()
initializes this component and all subcomponents.

initCurrentData

public void initCurrentData()
resets this leftPanel. Both imagePanels will be cleared and get new images.

addMPanelListener

public void addMPanelListener(MPanelListener listener)
registeres an MPanelListener to receive events when a bigImage is clicked. This listener is passed immediatly to both MultiImagePanels.

getPanelIndex

public int getPanelIndex(int imageID)
returns the shown-index of an image specified by its index in the images- array. If this image is not shown, -1 will be returned
Parameters:
imageID - an int specifying an image by its fieldIndex.
Returns:
an int encoding the location of the image on this leftPanel. value is corresponding to static fields UPPER and LOWER. Returns -1 if image is not shown at all.

getImageID

public int getImageID(int panelID)
Returns the index in the images array for the image that is currently shown on the MultiImagePanel encoded by panelID.
Parameters:
panelID - an int encoding the location of the requested MultiImagePanel.
Returns:
an int as the index in the currentCardImages-Array.

hasEqualImages

public boolean hasEqualImages()
Checks, whether both multiImagePanels are showing the same motives.
Returns:
true if both images are equal by its reference,
false otherwise.

setBigImage

public void setBigImage(int panelID,
                        int imageID)
Sets the image of an MultiImagePanel. The image is specified by its index in the currentCardImages array, the panel is specified by the UPPER / LOWER constants.
Parameters:
panelID - an int specifying the bigImagePanel to be target
imageID - an int specifying the image to be set.

setBigimageHint

public void setBigimageHint(boolean b)
shows or hides the hint for both multiImagePanels.
Parameters:
b - a boolean describing, whether the hint shall be shown or not.

setEnabled

public void setEnabled(boolean b)
enables or disables this component.
Overrides:
setEnabled in class java.awt.Component
Parameters:
a - boolean, whether to enable or disable.
